title: Vermox 100MG 30ML Susp
details:
Vermox or mebendazole (Generic Name) is an oral suspension that is prescribed by doctors to patients who have newly hatched insect worms inside the intestine or worm infection.

Vermox is mostly used to treat worm infections caused by whipwo

READ MORE
precautions: Vermox During PregnancyNo resources confirm that Vermox might harm an unborn baby but research applied on animals tells us that it might harm the baby in the first twelve-week of pregnancy (First Trimester).It also does not enter the maternal milk, which could harm the newborn baby while breastfeeding. This means that Vermox is safe in the pregnancy period after the first trimester.Vermox Dosage For ChildrenChildren in a very certain range of age are mostly targeted by the worm infection within the intestine and mebendazole (Vermox) is the medicine for the prevention of worm infection in the intestines.Every patient has their own prescribed instructed dose; the same applies to children who are having worm infections in the intestine. Vermox is not to be given to children below 1 year for oral suspension and below 2 years for chewable tablets.Vermox is generally to be prescribed by the doctors as a one day dose or for 3 days which has to be taken twice a day. If the doctor has only prescribed for a single day, you might need it the next week for complete prevention.Tell your doctor your medical history of, Anemia, Liver disease, Intestinal problems, e.g., Crohn's disease, Ulcerative colitis. During pregnancy, this medication should be used only when clearly needed. This drug passes into breast milk. Consult your doctor before breastfeeding.
